channel.title: If i switch user on windows 7 comp would server go off
channel.description: if i was to switch user on windows 7 computer would the server go off or would it stay on

item.title: If i switch user on windows 7 comp would server go off
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

whackatre:

Alright, thanks for the help. I guess I have been a complete idiot for blaming server downtime on DDoS attacks. xD

Haha;3, well technically speaking it could only take one if the Dos’er had a better internet connection(upload and bandwidth wise) and capacity to use it but generally that doesn’t happen with VPS’s as vps’s have smexi internet connections. But usually people have 0.5 or less upload 2mbs upload at max but they’d still generally need around 50 people of that speed ddosing you at the same time :p.

Read full topic
item.source: If i switch user on windows 7 comp would server go off

item.source: If i switch user on windows 7 comp would server go off

item.title: If i switch user on windows 7 comp would server go off
item.dc:creator: @Daginith Daginith
item.description:
@Daginith wrote:

whackatre:

Usually about how many different connections does it take for someone to DDoS you (on let’s say, a VPS)?

On an ‘standard’ vps, my guess is about 400-600 connections doing the same action at the same time (Just say sending back a login packet) before it crashes. Also depends on how good the server was coded.

Read full topic

item.source: If i switch user on windows 7 comp would server go off

item.title: If i switch user on windows 7 comp would server go off
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

[quote=“Mopar Coder, post:13, topic:436916”][quote author=Kidpaparoach link=topic=539630.msg3950210#msg3950210 date=1332215862]

Admin password, because his parents take away his computer, get vps.

Not everyone has money you know, like atm although I could get money for a vps I owe £200 so I wouldn’t buy one. I think he would if he could

Well in that cause dont host a rsps, why would you risk hosting on your computer, easier chance of getting DDosed.

Assuming they have a better internet connection than you… Personally I’m getting upgraded to 60mbs internet however I’m not hosting myself anyways and its Dos Ddos is multiple people.
No need to risk, I only would use a webclient if I hosted so they’d have to decompile my client just to find my ip even then I can change my Ip in under a minute so its just a lil bit of hastle not much.
But then again why would they go to all that hastle if it would only take me 2mins to get around it o.o, also I believe you can input the ip html wise also(not 100% sure) so I wouldn’t have to rejar then again they’d need only to check my pages source but then again why would someone go to that much effort over a rsps? o.o
Its not a risk for me, also its not common to get ddosed tbh. In time for donations for a vps you most likely wont get dosed.

A DDoS attack is usually 1 person with a ‘Master’ computer hooked up to ‘Slave’ computers connected to ‘Drone’ computers. The drone computers come from everywhere, so its not able to be stopped.

Or it can just be a bunch of retards doing a dos at the same person at once, what anonymous does. way to over complicate it dag;o
[/quote]

I got DDosed so much, well me and lots of xat nerds, always were bragging about which DDos is stronger, it got boring, so then i closed my server, little off topic but DDosing is a bad thing and only way to avoid it is adding iptables.[/quote]
Its dos if one person, ddos if multiple people do it to one person/server. Whoever has the best internet connection will come out on top basically, if the person getting dos/ddos’ed has a better internet at best the attempt will only slow them down. It works by sending so many packets not allowing the victim to reach the internet…
Idc about your dos story because dos’ing is silly and illegal… stay away from it. Whats an iptable…?

Read full topic
item.source: If i switch user on windows 7 comp would server go off

item.title: If i switch user on windows 7 comp would server go off
item.dc:creator: @Mopar_Coder Mopar Coder
item.description:
@Mopar_Coder wrote:

[quote=“Kidpaparoach, post:12, topic:436916”][quote author=Daginith link=topic=539630.msg3950202#msg3950202 date=1332215726]

Admin password, because his parents take away his computer, get vps.

Not everyone has money you know, like atm although I could get money for a vps I owe £200 so I wouldn’t buy one. I think he would if he could

Well in that cause dont host a rsps, why would you risk hosting on your computer, easier chance of getting DDosed.

Assuming they have a better internet connection than you… Personally I’m getting upgraded to 60mbs internet however I’m not hosting myself anyways and its Dos Ddos is multiple people.
No need to risk, I only would use a webclient if I hosted so they’d have to decompile my client just to find my ip even then I can change my Ip in under a minute so its just a lil bit of hastle not much.
But then again why would they go to all that hastle if it would only take me 2mins to get around it o.o, also I believe you can input the ip html wise also(not 100% sure) so I wouldn’t have to rejar then again they’d need only to check my pages source but then again why would someone go to that much effort over a rsps? o.o
Its not a risk for me, also its not common to get ddosed tbh. In time for donations for a vps you most likely wont get dosed.

A DDoS attack is usually 1 person with a ‘Master’ computer hooked up to ‘Slave’ computers connected to ‘Drone’ computers. The drone computers come from everywhere, so its not able to be stopped.
[/quote]
Or it can just be a bunch of retards doing a dos at the same person at once, what anonymous does. way to over complicate it dag;o[/quote]

I got DDosed so much, well me and lots of xat nerds, always were bragging about which DDos is stronger, it got boring, so then i closed my server, little off topic but DDosing is a bad thing and only way to avoid it is adding iptables.

Read full topic

item.title: If i switch user on windows 7 comp would server go off
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Although, you shouldn’t be running a server on a computer that you will be switching users on (a home computer/network).

Read full topic
item.source: If i switch user on windows 7 comp would server go off

item.title: If i switch user on windows 7 comp would server go off
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

Shouldn’t do, try it out n check it out? Switch user and access the client from the user you switch to and see if your servers still online.

Read full topic
item.source: If i switch user on windows 7 comp would server go off

item.title: If i switch user on windows 7 comp would server go off
item.dc:creator: @Advocatus Advocatus
item.description:
@Advocatus wrote:

Normally, switching the user does not kill running applications, logging off does. However, when i used to do it on my laptop, the internet connectivity would stop on the last user and start for the new user. Doubt that is a problem for other people though.

Read full topic
item.source: If i switch user on windows 7 comp would server go off

item.title: If i switch user on windows 7 comp would server go off
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

depends if you’ve got a server key. iirc, unless you’ve got a multi-user key all application from another user will be killed upon log off/switch.

Read full topic
item.source: If i switch user on windows 7 comp would server go off

if i was to switch user on windows 7 computer would the server go off or would it stay on

Depends if you have it set to kill tasks. I dont think so though, if your not logging off.
